channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- QRadar Network Security
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- QRadar Network Security

item.title: CVE-2020-4157|2024-08-04T08:00:06.988Z -- ibm -- qradar%20network%20security
item.description: IBM QRadar Network Security 5.4.0 and 5.5.0 contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data. IBM X-Force ID: 174337.

item.title: CVE-2020-4153|2024-08-04T08:00:06.919Z -- ibm -- qradar%20network%20security
item.description: IBM QRadar Network Security 5.4.0 and 5.5.0 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 174269.

item.title: CVE-2020-4159|2024-08-04T08:00:07.050Z -- ibm -- qradar%20network%20security
item.description: IBM QRadar Network Security 5.4.0 and 5.5.0 discloses sensitive information to unauthorized users which could be used to mount further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 174339.

item.title: CVE-2020-4152|2024-08-04T08:00:07.042Z -- ibm -- qradar%20network%20security
item.description: IBM QRadar Network Security 5.4.0 and 5.5.0 transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be obtained using man in the middle techniques. IBM X-Force ID: 17467.

item.title: CVE-2020-4160|2024-08-04T08:00:07.352Z -- ibm -- qradar%20network%20security
item.description: IBM QRadar Network Security 5.4.0 and 5.5.0 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to properly enable HTTP Strict Transport Security. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information using man in the middle techniques. IBM X-Force ID: 174340.
